It is most commonly known as the seat of the [[Basilica della Santa Casa]], a popular Catholic pilgrimage site. ==Location== Loreto is located {{convert|127|m|2|abbr=on|lk=out}} above sea-level on the right bank of the [[Musone]] river. It is 22 km by rail SSE of [[Ancona]]. Like many places in the Marche, it provides good views from the [[Apennine Mountains|Apennines]] to the [[Adriatic Sea|Adriatic]]. ==Main sights== Loreto's main monuments occupy the four sides of the [[piazza]]: the college of the [[Society of Jesus|Jesuits]], the Palazzo Comunale (formerly the Palazzo Apostolico), designed by [[Donato Bramante|Bramante]], with an art gallery with works of [[Lorenzo Lotto]], [[Simon Vouet|Vouet]] and [[Annibale Carracci]] as well as a collection of [[maiolica]], and the [[Shrine of the Holy House]] (''Santuario della Santa Casa''). The city has also a massive line of walls designed by [[Antonio da Sangallo the Younger]], which were erected from 1518 and reinforced in the 17th century. ==Gallery== <gallery> File:062 3A.JPG|The ''Basilica della santa casa'' from behind File:Ancona loreto.jpg|The ''Basilica della santa casa'' </gallery> ==Twin towns -
